bibl.title: Despatch from Samuel S. Sevier to Thomas F. Bayard, February 10, 1887
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p: No. 55
U.S. Consulate General Monrovia Feby 10/87
Mr. S. S. Sevier-
To the Secretary of State.
Subject
Death of Miss Enica Knapp an American citizen.
Synopsis
Death of Miss Knapp a missionary of the Free Methodist Church-- Inventory of her personal property - her stated residence.
U.S. Consulate General Monrovia Feby 10/87
Hon. T. F. Bayard, Secretary of State Washington D.C.

Sir: It becomes my painful duty to inform you that a missionary of the Free Methodist Church by the name of Miss Enica Knapp who had been only two months within the bounds of this Consulate working earnestly to spread the gospel of

of Jesus Christ in this land died on the 2nd of Feby from the contagion fever of this country. Inventory of her personal property has been taken and will be disposed off just as soon as I can obtain the right address of her relatives. The place of her birth is unknown to me. I am told by a distant friend that Mrs. Afford Wilkins #26 W. 38th Street New York City is her nearest known relative. The expenses of her funeral
funeral were settled without auctioning any of her effects accofding to the Consular Regulations. In inclose an inventory of her effects.
I have the honor to be Sir Your obedient Servant
Samuel S. Sevier Acting U.S. Consul Gen.
Hon. T. F. Bayard Secretary of State Washington D.C.
Inclosure
1. Inventory of the effects of Miss Knapp
Inventory

1 Piece of goods Patch work for two quilts not joined Three quilt tops joined 1 piece of cashmere 1 pillow tick 10 pieces of cloth 2 pieces of flannel underwear 5 night dresses 10 pieces of underwear 3 white skirts 8 aprons 4 Waists 1 Tidy 1 Pair of Stockings 1 Missionary Egg with contents 1 White Marsailles Basque 2 Knit Undergarments 1 Velveteen cloak 2 Pillow Shams

6 Napkins 8 Handkerchiefs 5 Towels 12 Dresses 1 Pair of Rubbers 3 Pair of Shoes 2 Pair of Slippers 1 Shawl 1 Table Cloth 1 Water Proof Circular 2 Skirts 1 Quilted Quilt 1 Flannel Blanket 1 Pin cushion 26 Books and Albums 1 Silver Knife, Fork, & Napkin ring 1 China cup & Saucers 2 Pictures Large size 1 Hat, 2 Pictures, 1 watch
1 Box with contents 1 Hand Satchel 1 Bag Trinkets Number of Pictures 1 Parasol 1 Comb
Samuel S. Sevier Acting U.S. Consul Gen.
Witnesses
Robert L. Harris J. O. Hines
